reviews.text:
NOPE.

This place only survives due to the good location, but there are a LOT of hotels here! I advise you (you!) to choose the one with better wifi (the wifi here SUCKS) and service personnel that respond before HOURS pass. Seriously, we asked for a towel and a roll of T.P. Those things should of been here first, but we asked for them, and it took A WHILE.

Seriously, how hard is it to have wifi that doesn't drop out every couple of minutes?

tl;dr: good location, bad service

A comfortable room in the hotel perfectly situated for exploring the old market area and eateries, about 12 minutes walk from the cathedral and railway station. 24 hour reception desk with friendly staff. There is a restaurant and bar at the ground floor and outside.
Excellent location in the city centre, rooms are OK, but not luxurious. Offers everything you want for a city trip.

The rooms were a bit small, but it was just me so it worked. The location is great for easy access to most things but they need better window insulation. It got very chilly in the room with manually operated furnaces. Also it sits above the bars so it was very loud until late at night.

Have eaten here a few times over recent years. Not stayed here at their hotel. The food options are varied and have always been well prepared and presented. They have a great selection of pizzas, themed as the twelve apostles. Plus many other dishes. They have spaces better suited to smaller more intimate groups and others for larger groups. Booking recommended, though we've always managed to get a table.
